headline: Easy Peach Cobbler
description: This simple peach cobbler is ready in 35 minutes. Made with five pantry staples (including canned peaches), it's easy to whip up for last-minute company.

video.description: Sweet, simple, peach dessert ready in under an hour.
video.name: Easy Peach Cobbler

name: Easy Peach Cobbler
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can sliced peaches, with juice

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Beat sugar and butter together in a 1-quart baking dish. Mix in flour and milk until smooth. Pour peaches and juice over top.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Terrible, not the right consistency, it was a bread like texture, def need more peaches. Bottom line it was so embarrassing that I made this dessert to bring to someone's house and it was not good at all. And I had to cook it like an extra 20-30 min or it would have been complete mush

I am 51 years old. Although I grew up in New Orleans, my grandparents were from the country in Mississippi. My grandmother and mother have been making this exact recipe my entire life. I acquired the recipe when I moved out as as adult. We cook it at 375 for 35-40 minutes.

This is a delicious desert that was greatly enjoyed by family, new neighbors, and new Momma and Daddy. There are a couple modifications that were required. It took longer and a hotter oven is needed. I set to 400 degrees on convection and baked for 40 minutes to achieve a lovely appearing golden crust. I used 1/2 the liquid from the peaches and to the liquid I stirred in cinnamon to our taste (about 2 tsp). Each time I gift a cooked dish to someone, I include the recipe and recommend Allrecipes as well.

i followed exactly as the recipe stated, but the crust was not firm looking or that of cobber. Looked not done. I cooked it additional 20 minutes, the consistency just did not seem right for a cobbler. :(
Love this recipe! My fiancé loved it too. (And she’s picky) I did add 1 tsp of ground cinnamon. Very good!
Love the recipe. So easy to make and tastes yummy!

The only thing I had to change about this recipe is that I had to cook it for a little over an hour. It is really really delicious. Mixing the butter and sugar makes a terrible mess, but the end result is worth it.
Quick, easy & delicious! It cooked perfectly & the whole family loved it! Will definitely use this recipe every time I make.

I followed the recipe, knowing it was lacking in flavor so I added 1 1/2 Tsp. Cinnamon and bit of Nutmeg, and upped the baking time to 1 Hr. Turned out delicious. Let cool for 15 minutes add Ice Cream and you have a winner.

I followed the video attached for the recipe, even used the exact same glass pan, which is eight or nine inches. This would have been much better put in a larger pan. Other recipes very similar to this one do call for a 9 x 11 pan. It would have cooked better and been done at the designated time if put in a larger pan. As it was I had to cook it a lot longer and it was "doughier" than when I made peach cobbler before. Next time I'll make this using a larger pan.
Yes I put instant peach oatmeal on top

This is by far the best peach cobbler recipe. 
Five stars!!
I use frozen peaches so I added sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg to taste. Turned out wonderful
The dough took an extra 15 minutes and was still a bit soft. The dough needs spices for flavor.
Easy!

I made this according the recipe. It was delicious and easy. I am a huge fan of peach cobbler and I was a bit scared to try to make it without a cake mix. Simple. Easy. Straight forward. My favorite kind of recipe.
I made it in a 9x9 with 1 15 oz can of peaches. I think maybe 2 cans with only one with juice would be better but overall very good!
Very easy to make!
Love it, so easy and fast
This was barely edible. The texture was so strange-like chewy gelatin. I followed the recipe exactly, so I’m not sure what went wrong. I will not be making this again.
No substitutes it was great, added a little peach ice cream delicious.?
This turned out really good! Never knew you could make an easy peach cobbler recipe! Tastes great!
Easy as pie!
I used self rising flour.

It's really simple and easy to make. It did taste good as is but I thought it was a really safe recipe to experiment with.
I used a strawberry mixture(14oz slightly mashed strawberries, tbs of lemon juice, tsp of cornstarch) in place of peaches.
I used half a cup of white sugar and half a cup of brown sugar. I threw in a tsp of salt and a tsp of pumpkin pie seasoning in dry ingredients. I didn't have regular milk so I used evaporated milk. 
This cobbler kills at every event I bring it and never last a week at home. My friend who doesn't like cooked fruit even loved it.
My mama made this for us growing up. Definitely one of my favorites
Added blueberries granola and walnuts at the bottom of my pan to a crust

I didn't have self rising flour so I used Bisquick mix instead. I also only had a one pound can of sliced peaches so I put the whole can in. It is taking longer than the 25-30 minutes to cook though but it looks and smells good. I am currently at 45 min. @ 350. 50 min. total but oh it's so good!!
No changes and definitely I will make it again!
Oh My Goodness!!!! So yummy...

This is a great, easy recipe that's quick to make. I did make a couple minor changes. I added 1/2 tsp of cinnamon and 1/4 tsp nutmeg to the batter. It is how my Mom and Grandma made peach pies, and I love the taste and smell. I didn't have a 9" square pan so made it in my small oblong pan which is @ 8 1/2 by 6. It took longer to bake - 45 minutes rather than 30, to get the cobbler top browned.

I don't understand how this has such rave reviews. I made it exactly as the recipe states and did not like it. I grew up in the south eating peach cobbler and this one is not good. There is too much butter and milk. The crust portion is much too soft and gooey. When you pour the can of peaches including the syrup, there should be a more dry dough mix to bake and absorb the syrup. The dough is very wet. I would not make this again.
Yummy! My mom made this when I was a little girl- All those memories came back like I was sitting back at home and being 8yrs old all over again.
Very good recipe!
Easy to make and taste awesome! I added a pinch of nutmeg in mine.
Fast. Easy. Everybody likes it. :)
Will not use this recipe ever again
I made it exactly like the recipe and it was very good. I believe it would have been better if i had used a more shallow dish. I believe it would have been a little less doughy.

This was a really good recipe, easy to make. I only added 1/2 a teaspoon of baking powder because I didn't have self rising flour it was so good my husband asked me to make it again for his birthday instead of cake.

I copied another reader's suggestion: melt the butter into the bottom of the pan, pour peaches over the top - sprinkle cinnamon and nutmeg on top of the peaches and then mix together the milk, flour & sugar. Pour the milk mixture right in the center of the peaches. By the end of baking the milk mixture rises to the top and makes an awesome topping. I may try adding vanilla the next time around per another person's comment. I double the recipe as my boys love it!

I used all-purpose flour and 2 tsp baking powder. Cut sugar in half (good move) and used less butter (it was still too much). It was OK. Too runny. Baked about an hour!
No, wouldn’t make again.

I will certainly make it again.
So easy and enjoyed it very much.
It was not good had to cook it longer and had no taste!!!
great didnt make any changes

I followed it to the letter....
Had to cook it for 2 1/2 hours and it still had raw dough. 
I had to throw the whole thing out. What a disappointment.
So easy had to use flour, so I did like one reviewer advised 1 1/2 tsp bpowder.
Very easy to make and tastes great too. will make again

This recipe has been in my family since before my grandmother and I am 58 yrs. old. All of the ingredients are correct. But you mix together your milk, flour, and sugar. Melt your butter in your dish in the preheating oven until its good and hot. Pour your batter in the hot butter and pour your peaches on top of the batter, and do not stir. Do not cover and your crust will have deliciously crisp edges, and a nice gooey cake like center. Very good indeed!!! Enjoy!!

I must be missing something. I followed the recipe exactly. So many of you have given this recipe 4-5 stars. Something must be wrong with my palate because I didn't like this very much at all. At firs sight I noticed after cooking it for 1 hour the dough never formed into a crust. I went ahead a put 1 tsp of vanilla and 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. It didn't help this recipe taste any better. I love peach cobbler and thought this would be a winner. I was disappointed.

I must be missing something. I followed the recipe exactly. So many of you have given this recipe 4-5 stars. Something must be wrong with my palate because I didn't like this very much at all. At firs sight I noticed after cooking it for 1 hour the dough never formed into a crust. I went ahead a put 1 tsp of vanilla and 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. It didn't help this recipe taste any better. I love peach cobbler and thought this would be a winner. I was disappointed.
Very easy recipe. I make it all of the time. Everyone loves it. I highly recommend this recipe.
Easiest cobbler ever and delicious. I add some cinnamon and vanilla to the peaches. I melt my butter in the baking dish, then add the mixture and top with the peaches. Comes out perfect every time.
Very easy recipe. I used a little less sugar and 29 ozs of peaches. Also baked mines at 425 on convection setting. Turned out perfect!!
I added cinnamon & nutmeg and cooked evenly in my pampered chef pie stone. My boyfriend, family & coworkers loved it! I'll definitely make it again!
Turned out wonderful we loved went over great
I followed exactly like the recipe says and it came out great taste good with ice cream we enjoyed it I will make it again thank you
I tried your recipe it was good.
This turned out very well. I added a teaspoon of vanilla and some cinnamon. I served it warm with a bit of cream. Delish!

I made it how the recipe said, except one i used a deep dish and the other i used the 9 inch pan. The deep dish turned out fantastic, nice and creamy and flavorful. The 9 inch was good, but a little dry. Then i made my own glaze out of leftover peaches, lemon juice, butter, then brown and regular sugar. Tasted great!
Just like my moms!!! Great and easy recipe. Like the others I baked about a hour to get it nice and brown. I also add 2 tsp of vanilla and a little cinnamon.

Too much dough - peaches ratio. I only used 3/4 cup and reduced sugar. Also, it didn't say whether to used the syrup with the peaches, so I used 1/2 of it. I cooked at 360 degrees for 30 min and turned it off and left it in the oven without opening the door for additional cooking time. The flavor turned out perfect even without enough peaches.

I used margarine instead of butter and I used water instead of milk (had to use what was available at the time). I must say I was surprised at how SWEET the cobbler is. I will absolutely be using less sugar, may take it down to 1/2 a cup next time being that the syrup in the canned peaches bumps up the sweetness factor to a highly inappropriate amount lol. I will also use a little more than a cup of flour, maybe a cup and a half. I hope I remember to come back and share my experience with the revision. Overall, I'm still going to eat every bit :)
This was easy and very good. I substituted Splenda for the sugar. We ate it topped with sugar free Cool Whip. The crust was a bit spongy and we loved it that way. I'll make this again.
This recipe did not work out for me. All I have is a pan full of mush
made it the first time,.dont know if i didnt blend it enough but i cooke it for like 2 hours and nothing worth eating...just tried it again looks alot better.will try again

.
It took at least an hour to cook and could have had a lot more flavor (cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla). The recipe isn't good as-is.

I am a volunteer cook for a homeless shelter and I found this recipe easy to add to make it a larger amount for I cook for about 100 people.I did add cinnamon and nutmeg to the peaches and I have to gladly say they loved the cobbler.

While very easy to make, it was painfully flavourless. I added some cinnamon and nutmeg, but it wasn't enough to make it taste like anything. Also, it didn't take anywhere close to 25-30 minutes to bake. After 55 minutes, I increased the temperature, but it still took another 10 minutes.
We love this recipe! Have made it twice in the past week! Definitely a staple recipe in my box now! =))

just tried it today and omg so good my kids love it also, I didnt make any substitutions at all, i had previously been spending money to buy the cobbler mix and i google this recipe ,I know longer need to buy the mix , i love this

This was a very easy recipe. My husband couldn't believe I actually made it myself. I did take a short cut and used two pie crust out of the frozen section in the grocery store. I added cinnamon and sugar.
Not as good as I had hoped. It took a long time to cook. It never did brown on top and it wasn't sweet at all. If I were to try it again, I would definitely alter the recipe as others have.
I also had to cook it loger but it was good.
Fast, easy and always a hit when I serve it...never a complaint!!!

I first tried this recipe in Germany 24 years ago! It was a quick go to, delicious crowd pleaser. I also add a bit of real vanilla and a bit of cinnamon. It is very easy and tasty. What more could you want in a cobbler. My recipe is folded, spilled on and well used. I have copied this for dozens of other home cooks. My hubby loves it warm with a scoop of French vanilla ice cream.. Blessings!

While it is simple and easy to make, I found it way too sweet and it did take much longer to brown. I could see myself liking it with much less sugar, and with the variations suggested in other reviews (adding cinnamon or vanilla extract).

I made 3/4 of the recipe and used a can of cherry pie filling (in a large glass pie plate) for cherry cobbler. I thought it was a bit too buttery. My boyfriend loved it! I made the recipe the same way again today for him. Thanks for sharing. :)

This was my first time making peach cobbler. I added some brown sugar on top and had to bake an additional 25 minutes until it was golden brown. The kids and hubby loved it though. Will make it again.
I'm making this tonight just as the recipe calls BUT I can't seem to understand a peach coobler with no cinnamin so I MUST add this into my peach mixture then 2 TBSNs into the batter itself.
It was simple to put together but despite following the recipe exactly, I cooked it way over the time, 25min or so. Yet it never did get fully cooked, mushy unfortunately.

Wow! Although this was not a cobbler as I remember - maybe I was thinking more of a peach crisp, but it was amazing! My daughter ate it the next morning for breakfast and an after-school snack. So easy - I used fresh peaches and blue plums and it was magnificent. Thanks for sharing! This has definitely become a family favorite :)

I was looking for a good cobbler recipe and tried this one. I altered it a little as I was using home canned peaches. I didn't know how much juice I had compared with store bought canned peaches so I poured most of the juice out and then put a little cornstarch in the peaches before I poured the peaches and their juice over the batter. 

I also made a second batch and cut the milk and sugar way down to make more of a pastry top. I was such a hit at a potlock dinner, that I never got seconds.
We love this recipe. My husband made it for his church and was one of the winners in a cobbler contest. We will definitely make it again!

Great recipe! Not quite my granny's but it is still great! I used 2 cans of Peach pie filling instead of just the canned peaches. Add 2 tsp vanilla, 2tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp nutmeg. The filling liquid from the peaches caramelizes the crust and makes it that much better. Cook 350 deg/1hour.

I added a 1/2 tsp pure vanilla extract and a 1/2 tsp grated lemon peel to the batter. I also used 3 average sized fresh peaches. When fresh Colorado peaches are at peak season, why used canned peaches? I baked it a 375°F for 1 hour and the crust was a nice golden brown. I live at 6000 feet so baking is tricky up here, you may need to bake this cobbler for a shorter time, just keep an eye on it. Be sure to allow the cobbler to rest on a wire rack for 15 minutes before serving it.

I really enjoyed this recipe... it was simple and amazing. I did adjust the recipe for 12 servings and instead of two 15 ounces cans of peaches I just used 1 29 ounce can. I also added 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract and a dash of cinnamon (although afterward I wish I had used a full teaspoon). It did cook for almost twice as long, that doesnt adjust in the directions. It came out wonderfully and tasty MAGNIFICENT!!!!!
This is very sweet, i only used half the sugar the second go around, but it is amazing and so quick!
My mom has made this (only doubled for 9x13) It is awesome. You can also use frozen fruit thawed with juices. We love it with blackberries, peach is good too.
I found I needed to cook this cobbler 10 min more than stated ...I also added cinnamon on top. all in all an easy dessert and tasty.
As far as making it go 5 stars , just put it in the oven , will get back to rating the taste in a little bit !

I tried this recipe two times because the first attempt came out very runny and mushy. I thought perhaps it was a mistake on my part. Tried it again and made sure I followed the directions exactly, came out runny and mushy again. Not a good recipe for me.
this was not a good recipe at all. tooooo much liquid..cooked for over an hour and still watery dough...was very disappointed

This is so easy and so delicious! I double this and add 2 tsp of vanilla to the sugar/flour mixture and I bake it in a deep casserole dish...it makes such a beautiful dessert and it's perfect with vanilla ice cream
This is super easy and tasty. I added vanilla too and think that is a good addition suggestion from others
A quick & easy dessert you can whip up at the last minute. I add about 1/2-3/4 cup brown sugar. A rich cobbler which is more cakey than crusty and is yummy with vanilla ice cream!
this was my first time to make peach cobbler and i was so supprised at how easy it was to make. it looks and taste amazing.

Love this recipe BUT the cooking time is too short. Mine took an hour but it was worth it! I used my own canned peaches which were spiced. If I were to use store bought canned peaches I would add cinnamon and nutmeg. I will definitely make this again!
I love this cobbler and so do my friends and family!!!! My husband is currently deployed and wishes I had a way to send this to him : )
this was fabulous! the cook time was off though, it was definitely not done in 30 minutes so I increased it to 1 hour and it came out perfect. Love the texture.
